options.text: Insertion Sort

options.text: Bubble Sort

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.text: It is the most efficient strategy for small lists of books.

title: Can you solve the river crossing riddle? - Lisa Winer

multiple-choice.question: What is the constraint on the number of lions and wildebeest on either side of the river?

options.label: A
options.text: The number of lions must always be equal to the number of wildebeest.

options.label: B
options.text: The number of lions must always be greater than the number of wildebeest.

options.label: C
options.text: The number of lions must never outnumber the number of wildebeest.

options.label: D
options.text: The number of wildebeest must never outnumber the number of lions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the minimum number of trips required to get all six animals across the river safely?

options.label: A
options.text: 5 trips

options.label: B
options.text: 7 trips

options.label: C
options.text: 9 trips

options.label: D
options.text: 11 trips

multiple-choice.question: If two wildebeest cross the river first, what will happen to the remaining wildebeest?

options.label: A
options.text: It will be safe on the right bank.

options.label: B
options.text: It will be eaten by the lions on the right bank.

options.label: C
options.text: It will be able to cross the river alone.

options.label: D
options.text: It will have to wait for the raft to return.

multiple-choice.question: What is the first step in the solution that involves sending one lion and one wildebeest across the river first?

options.label: A
options.text: The lion stays on the left bank and the wildebeest returns to the right bank.

options.label: B
options.text: The lion returns to the right bank and the wildebeest stays on the left bank.

options.label: C
options.text: Both the lion and the wildebeest stay on the left bank.

options.label: D
options.text: Both the lion and the wildebeest return to the right bank.

multiple-choice.question: What is the final step in the solution to get all six animals across the river safely?

options.label: A
options.text: The two wildebeest cross the river together.

options.label: B
options.text: The two lions cross the river together.

options.label: C
options.text: The one lion rafts back and brings his fellow lions over one by one.

options.label: D
options.text: The one wildebeest rafts back and brings his fellow wildebeest over one by one.

title: How you could get away with murder in Yellowstone’s “Zone of Death"

options.label: C
options.text: A region with no law enforcement presence

options.label: D
options.text: A region with a high risk of natural disasters

options.text: Because Yellowstone was established before Wyoming, Idaho, and Montana joined the Union

options.label: C
options.text: Because of a geographical error

options.label: D
options.text: Because of a lack of jurisdiction in Idaho and Montana

options.label: B
options.text: The right to a trial by jury in the district where the crime was committed

options.label: C
options.text: The right to a trial by jury from the state and district where the crime was committed

options.label: D
options.text: The right to a trial by judge in the state where the crime was committed

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.text: Redrawing the district lines to match the state borders

options.label: B
options.text: Establishing a new court in Idaho

options.label: C
options.text: Increasing the number of law enforcement officers in Yellowstone

options.label: D
options.text: Creating a special task force to handle crimes in Yellowstone

title: Why should you listen to Vivaldi's "Four Seasons"? - Betsy Schwarm

options.text: The publication included poems that described the scenes Vivaldi intended to capture in musical terms.

options.label: C
options.text: It was the first time a composer had used a large ensemble to tell a story.

options.label: D
options.text: It was the first time a composer had written music for instrumental purposes only.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Johann Sebastian Bach

options.label: C
options.text: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: He used a large ensemble to tell a story.

options.label: B
options.text: He included complicated fugues in his music.

options.label: C
options.text: He provided specific plot content for instrumental music.

options.label: D
options.text: He only used strings and a harpsichord.

options.label: C
options.text: To provide entertainment for the wealthy aristocrats.

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and B.

multiple-choice.question: How did Vivaldi's approach to music composition differ from that of his contemporary, Bach?

options.label: A
options.text: Vivaldi preferred to write complicated fugues, while Bach did not.

options.label: B
options.text: Vivaldi preferred to offer readily accessible entertainment, while Bach wrote more complex music.

options.label: C
options.text: Vivaldi only used strings and a harpsichord, while Bach used a larger ensemble.

options.label: D
options.text: Vivaldi was not interested in attracting audiences, while Bach was.
